title.rendered: The 10 highest paid players in world football

content.rendered:
The soccer world is going through an extremely complex moment, especially economic level. The coronavirus pandemic has hit the big clubs hard. The box office or merchandising revenue they have vanished. And they have had to take care of some tremendously high salariesfruit of the inflation of recent years.

Now everyone is being forced to take measures measures, which especially affect the millionaire salary of its footballers. A essential decision in order to reduce this tremendous blow. And it is that, possibly, it will take a long time for the profits to be recovered.

At the moment, the entities are already negotiating with many of their important stars wage cutsfor adapt your emoluments to the current context. If the clubs generate less, obviously their cracks will have to charge less. Something that is harming especially the most important footballers.

Messi, the number 1

Precisely, Forbes magazine recently announced the list of the 10 highest paid players in world football, and that they will have to adapt their salaries to help their clubs. The list is led by Leo Messi which he acquires with his salary, bonuses and publicity, an annual salary of €131 million. His constant renewals and salary increases at Can Barça, in addition to his advertising contract with Adidas, raise him to the top-1 despite the fact that his market value is not the highest in the market.

Cristiano Ronaldo ranked second, with a salary of 118 million euros total per year, where Nike has a lot to say. Likewise, the podium of cracks completes it Neymar with 95 million euros per year. The Brazilian is already negotiating his renewal with the Parisians, with a figure similar to this figure.

The fourth place is occupied by the highest paid footballer of Real Madrid, Gareth Bale, with 38 million euros. While the top5 closes it Antoine Griezmann, with the same amount of salary as the Welshman on loan at Totteham. On this same step is Eden Hazardwho evidently with his constant injuries, has not amortized his price in Chamartín.

Cristiano Ronaldo, Messi and Neymar, in a montage | networks

manchego Andres IniestaSurprisingly, it ranks seventh. The Spanish midfielder from Vissel Kobe receives 34 million euros a year in his current stage in Japanese football, with a lot of advertising weight and bonuses. At number 8 is Raheem Sterling, from Manchester City, with 33 million a year. The highest paid in the Premier League.

Finally, this ranking is closed by the brand new Golden Boot and The Best Robert Lewandowski, with its 29 million euros; and a Kylian Mbappe, the best valued footballer in the world, who earns a salary of 27 million euros per year. A number that could grow considerably when he resolves his future in the coming months.

The 10 highest paid players in the world

These are the ten highest paid soccer players in the world:

  • Leo Messi (Barcelona Football Club): 131 million

  • Cristiano Ronaldo (Juventus Turin): 118 million

  • Neymar Jr (PSG): 95 million

  • Gareth Bale (Real Madrid): 38 million

  • Antoine Griezmann (Barcelona Soccer Club): 38 million

  • Eden Hazard (Real Madrid): 38 million

  • Andres Iniesta (Vissel Kobe): 34 million

  • Raheem Sterling (Manchester City): 33 million

  • Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich): 29 million

  • Kylian Mbappé (PSG): 27 million
